question: Which state/UT government has launched 'Happiness Curriculum' for students up to class 8?
explanation: Arvind Kejriwal, the Chief Minister of Delhi, launched the \'Happiness Curriculum\' for students of nursery to Class 8 in government schools on July 2, 2018. The curriculum was launched in the presence of the Dalai Lama. Students across schools can expect a ‘happiness’ period of 45 minutes. Each class will begin with a five-minute meditation session. The Happiness period was designed and prepared by a team of 40 Delhi government teachers, educators and volunteers over a period of six months. It will also include value education and mental exercises.
